Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A.B.S. √® alla ricerca di un Data Scientist per ampliare il team di Milano!

Sei la persona giusta? Leggi l‚Äôannuncio e aiutaci a conoscerti inviandoci il tuo curriculum.




Il contesto di cui farai parte

A.B.S. (Advanced Business Solutions), nata nel gennaio 2000, si propone al mercato come uno dei pi√π importanti partner di qualit√† per le grandi aziende in ambito ERP Oracle.

Partener Oracle da sempre, A.B.S. accompagna le aziende nella loro trasformazione digitale e su sviluppi web innovativi gestiti in logica agile.

√à recentemente entrata in Altea Federation portando in dote il suo expertise sul mondo Oracle e sull‚Äôintero ciclo di vita dello sviluppo del software a livello enterprise.




3 cose che devi sapere in 3 hashtag




#DataEngineeringDataScience

L‚Äôattivit√† prevede lo studio e lo sviluppo di soluzioni legate al data science e al data engineering, partendo dalle pipeline dei dati fino ai servizi di reportistica. Il lavoro √® in modalit√† ibrida.

Come membro del Team Solutions avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† e la responsabilit√† di sviluppare soluzioni dati per grandi aziende clienti, continuare la formazione sui nuovi pattern di data engineering e data science e partecipare allo sviluppo interno del team data science con idee e POC.




#Holonicmantra

La nostra company fa parte del Gruppo Altea Federation. Diventerai un A-People e svolgerai la tua attivit√† a contatto con le altre FedCo. Ti confronterai con professionisti di diversi ambiti e condividerai con loro progetti ed esperienze professionali.

Se cerchi un ambiente dinamico e in continuo becoming‚Ä¶ here we are üòä




#Human

Altea Federation √® una realt√† aziendale Covey compliant, Secondo Stephen Covey, uno dei pi√π importanti studiosi a livello mondiale delle tematiche dell‚Äôefficacia e della crescita personale, sono 7 le abitudini (#7 Habits) che distinguono le persone altamente efficaci.

In altre parole, assertivit√†, empatia, team working, capacit√† di costruire relazioni. Gestirai situazioni complesse e ti interfaccerai con molteplici attori.

Le tue abilit√† relazionali faranno la differenza nel raggiungimento degli obiettivi.




Sei la persona che fa per noi se:

Hai una Laurea in discipline scientifiche
Hai esperienze di sviluppo su Cloud
Possiedi competenze nel design e nello sviluppo SQL, oltre ad avere familiarit√† con il calcolo distribuito (Spark)
Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e nel deployment di reportistica utilizzando Power BI o strumenti alternativi
Hai conoscenza di concetti di ETL, Data Warehouse, Datalake, Streaming e altri pattern legati alla gestione dei dati
Sei esperto nell‚Äôutilizzo di sistemi di versionamento (Git) e CI/CD nell‚Äôambito dei dati
Hai lavorato in progetti di data science e possiedi una buona conoscenza dei concetti e pattern di MLOps
Hai esperienza operativa su modelli LLM, architetture RAG e servizi cloud AI




Alteafederation sostiene ed incoraggia le differenze, a vantaggio della nostra comunit√† di a-people e di tutte le company della federation. Siamo orgogliosamente per la non discriminazione e per le pari opportunit√† e crediamo nel rispetto di tutte le leggi applicabili in materia. Se hai una disabilit√† o una necessit√† speciale, non esitare a candidarti, per noi ogni differenza √® una ricchezza!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Quale sar√† la tua sfida?¬†

Bip ha creato all‚Äôinterno del proprio Competence Centre ‚ÄúxTech‚Äù il pi√π nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall‚ÄôItalia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere.¬†

Nell‚Äôambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale presso le realt√† enterprise pi√π importanti d‚ÄôItalia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 5 anni di esperienza). La provenienza da societ√† di consulenza direzionale o informatica sar√† considerata un forte plus.¬†

Il/La Data Scientist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze di AI e Machine Learning, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacit√† di tradurli in algoritmi e poi di comunicare e utilizzare i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi.¬†

I/Le nostri/e Data Scientist verranno introdotti in contesti progettuali dove comprenderanno le esigenze del Cliente, daranno indicazione ai Data Engineer sulla preparazione desiderata dei dati, sceglieranno o costruiranno i migliori mix di modelli pi√π adatti al caso specifico, discuteranno gli output con il cliente e consegneranno il modello per l‚Äôottimizzazione e passaggio in produzione finale ai Data Engineer.¬†

In contesti pi√π semplificati in cui la componente di Data Engineering √® meno elaborata, i nostri Data Scientist procederanno in autonomia anche nella data preparation e nel porting in produzione dei modelli ingegnerizzati.¬†

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Fincons Group √® una societ√† internazionale di consulenza IT che da oltre 40 anni accompagna le imprese nel cogliere le opportunit√† del cambiamento digitale, proponendo soluzioni e tecnologie all‚Äôavanguardia che anticipano sempre il futuro. Alle aziende dei settori Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and Insurance, International Institutions, Manufacturing, Media, Public Administration e Transportation, Fincons offre consulenza sulle strategie IT in diversi ambiti, cos√¨ come servizi di system integration di pacchetti internazionali, soluzioni proprietarie e servizi IT in Smart-Shore e in Off-Shore. Il Gruppo conta oggi 2800 collaboratori e diverse sedi in Italia, Svizzera, UK, Germania, Francia, Belgio, Stati Uniti ed India.

Nell‚Äôottica di un potenziamento dell‚Äôorganico, il Gruppo √® alla ricerca di un profilo

Machine Learning Engineer

Siamo alla ricerca di profilo, Machine Learning Engineer per supportare il nostro progetto sul costo del credito.

La risorsa ideale avr√† esperienza nello sviluppo e implementazione di modelli di machine learning applicati all'analisi del credito.

Questa posizione richiede una forte capacit√† analitica, competenze avanzate in programmazione e una profonda comprensione delle tecniche di machine learning.

Responsabilit√†:

  • Sviluppare e implementare modelli di machine learning per l'analisi del costo del credito;
  • Analizzare grandi set di dati per identificare pattern e trend rilevanti;
  • Collaborare con i team di analisi del rischio per migliorare la precisione dei modelli di valutazione del credito;
  • Monitorare e ottimizzare le performance dei modelli di machine learning;
  • Preparare report dettagliati e presentazioni per la direzione aziendale;
  • Supportare la pianificazione strategica e le decisioni aziendali attraverso analisi approfondite.


Requisiti:

  • Esperienza di almeno 4 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di modelli di machine learning;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi di programmazione (es. Python, R, Java);
  • Esperienza con librerie e framework di machine learning (es. TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn);
  • Capacit√† di lavorare in modo indipendente e in team;
  • Attenzione ai dettagli e capacit√† di gestire progetti complessi;


Competenze specifiche richieste:

  • Analisi dei dati: Capacit√† di gestire e analizzare grandi set di dati utilizzando tecniche di machine learning;
  • Modellazione predittiva: Esperienza nella costruzione e validazione di modelli predittivi per la valutazione del rischio di credito;
  • Feature Engineering: Competenza nella selezione e trasformazione delle caratteristiche dei dati per migliorare la performance dei modelli.


Cosa offriamo:

  • Un percorso di carriera strutturato, volto alla valorizzazione e al potenziamento delle competenze;
  • Accesso ai programmi di formazione e certificazione aziendali;
  • Accesso ai corporate benefits aziendali.


Sede di lavoro: Vimercate (lavoro ibrido)

E‚Äô richiesta la disponibilit√† ad effettuare trasferte.

La ricerca √® rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi.

Saranno prese in considerazione, altres√¨, candidature di risorse che risultino appartenenti alle Categorie Protette con percentuale di invalidit√† superiore al 46%.

I dati saranno trattati e conservati esclusivamente ai fini della presente o di future selezioni, garantendo i diritti di cui all‚Äôart. 13 Dlgs 196/03 e del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679)

Title: AI Software Engineer
HTML:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek an AI Software Engineer who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

You will get the chance to:

  • Deploy and manage AI models in production environments, ensuring reliability and optimal performance;
  • Design and develop user interfaces and front-end systems that facilitate AI functionality;
  • Integrate and manage various data sources to support AI operations, ensuring data integrity and accessibility;
  • Create and maintain APIs for seamless interaction between system components, enhancing infrastructure integration;
  • Develop scalable frameworks for AI model deployment within the company infrastructure.


What will help you succeed:

  • At least 5 years in software development, with a minimum of 2 years focused on AI-related projects;
  • Demonstrated experience in a senior or leadership role, with the ability to mentor junior team members and lead complex projects;
  • Advanced proficiency in Python and/or Java;
  • Hands-on experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and generative AI tools such as LangChain or Langraph;
  • Familiarity with software development methodologies such as Agile, DevOps, and MLOps;
  • Proven ability to work effectively with data scientists and machine learning engineers in multidisciplinary teams;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to delivering high-quality solutions;
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for AI solution deployment;
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes for managing AI applications;
  • Knowledge of Git and CI/CD pipelines for an efficient, automated workflow;
  • Fluent English.


Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant‚Äôs Benefits.

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

Title: Junior ‚Äì AI & RPA Developer Data analytics
Description:
Junior - AI & RPA Developer Data analytics

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Smart Solutions Lab di Deloitte Business Solution nella sedi di Milano e Roma che lavorer√† in modalit√† Hybrid.

Smart Solutions Lab si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttivit√†, efficienza, qualit√† dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie di AI, Robotics Process Automation e Data Visualization. All‚Äôinterno del team ci si impegna a definire l'avanguardia delle soluzioni aziendali attraverso l'uso innovativo di concetti di intelligenza artificiale, Robotics Process Automation (RPA) e Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Oltre all'automazione dei processi, una parte delle attivit√† produttive si concentra sulla creazione di dashboard avanzate in ambito analytics tramite l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti come PowerBI o Qlik Sense. La Data Visualization √® cruciale per rendere i dati comprensibili, utili e facilmente fruibili da parte dei clienti.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sar√† inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Raccogliere, sintetizzare e analizzare dati complessi utilizzando strumenti e tecnologie appropriati;
Utilizzare efficientemente le principali tecnologie nell'analisi e progettazione dei processi aziendali end-to-end, dall'identificazione delle inefficienze (utilizzando tecniche quantitative e qualitative) alla progettazione e all'implementazione dei processi aziendali TO-BE;


Winning Requirements


Laurea in materie tecnico/scientifiche: Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Statistica
Disponibilit√† a viaggiare in Italia e all'estero
Confidenza con strumenti di Data Visualization (PowerBI, Qlik Sense, QlikView o Tableau)
Conoscenza base di strumenti di automazione robotica quali UiPath e BluePrism
Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL e utilizzo di SQL Server
Conoscenza di linguaggi per lo sviluppo web (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, ASP.NET, node.js)

Title: Data Scientist - LLM Model
HTML:
The Digital Evolution Company Of Today And Tomorrow

Progettiamo soluzioni end-to-end per la Digital Evolution gestendone ogni area, grazie alle nostre sei anime tecnologiche: LutechConsulting, LutechSolutions, LutechDigital, LutechCybersecurity, LutechServices e LutechCloud.

Siamo motivati da una passione inesauribile per l‚Äôinnovazione e una forte determinazione a superare limiti e ostacoli perch√© il fulcro di ogni nostro successo sono le nostre persone.

In Lutech potrai operare all‚Äôinterno di una vera community tecnologica, che contribuirai a far crescere e a migliorare con le tue competenze. Troverai un ambiente inclusivo e informale in cui nessuno √® un numero e tutti siamo un valore. Diamo importanza alla diversit√† riconoscendo che la forza di un team risiede nelle esperienze, prospettive e background unici che ogni persona porta con s√©.

Posizione

Come Data scientist, nella nostra practice Data analytics, sarai coinvolto in attivit√† di sviluppo e integrazione di modelli LLM.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di

  • Integrare modelli LLM utilizzando librerie Python (LangChain, LlamaIndex); sviluppare modelli di machine learning e algoritmi avanzati per risolvere problemi complessi;
  • analizzare dataset per estrarre insight significativi e supportare decisioni aziendali strategiche;
  • collaborare strettamente con i clienti per comprendere le loro esigenze e tradurle in soluzioni tecniche efficaci;
  • gestire progetti end-to-end, dalla definizione dei requisiti alla consegna delle soluzioni;
  • utilizzare e ottimizzare le risorse della piattaforma GCP per lo sviluppo e l'implementazione di modelli di data science.

Requisiti

IS THIS THE ROLE FOR YOU?

Cerchiamo Te Se Hai

  • Conoscenza approfondita di una o pi√π piattaforme cloud, con preferenza per GCP;
  • esperienza comprovata nell'interazione con i clienti e nella gestione delle loro aspettative;
  • ottima padronanza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python;
  • esperienza con strumenti di data visualization e reporting;
  • competenze eccellenti in comunicazione scritta e verbale.

Altre Informazioni

TAKE YOUR STEP INTO THE DIGITAL EVOLUTION.

Dai alla tua carriera l‚Äôaccelerata che sta aspettando: fai l‚Äôapplication ed entra in una realt√† unica nel suo genere.

La tua sede di lavoro potr√† essere Milano o Torino Potrai operare in modalit√† ibrida.

Lutech attua una politica di pari opportunit√† e accoglie le candidature senza operare alcuna discriminazione in base a razza, religione o convinzioni personali, origine etnica o nazionale, disabilit√†, et√†, cittadinanza, stato civile, inclusa convivenza di fatto e unione civile, orientamento sessuale, identit√† di genere, o qualsiasi altra condizione applicabile tutelata dalla legge.

Title: Global Sales Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services. With over 20,000 professionals and a network of 10,000 points of sale in 26 countries, Amplifon helps people rediscover the emotions of sound. The company values people as the key to its success, offering growth opportunities in a multicultural and international environment. Amplifon has been recognized as a "Top Employer 2025" in Europe, North America and Latin America, Australia and New Zeland by the Top Employers Institute. Additionally, we are proud to be the first Italian multinational to be certified among the Global ‚ÄúLeading Employers‚Äù 2025. This recognition spans all 26 countries where we operate.

In Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back-office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it‚Äôs only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.
¬†

Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybryd working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.

What we are looking for

The Global Sales Data & Analytics Specialist will join our Global team of Retail Excellence covering a key role in the development of advanced analysis, machine learning models and data visualization products. With exposure to the entire retail business, you will work to optimize sales strategies to generate new business opportunities and growth.

Main activities:


Works on strategically identified, cutting-edge data science use cases that cover the entire sales journey.
Uses advanced analytics methods to extract insights from business data.
Performs analysis and builds data-driven models to answer business questions and needs.
Create hypotheses and experiments to identify hidden relationships to direct new Sales strategies.
Develops visualizations and presentations to influence key stakeholders in implementing key recommendations from data science initiatives.
Develops machine learning models with the aim to facilitate Sales processes.
Collaborates with other team members across Marketing/CRM, IT, Reporting & Analytics to build shared data products, dashboards, and advanced analysis.


Skills and Experience:


Degree in quantitative fields like Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics, Computing and Engineering.
At least 2-3 years of experience in data science projects, preferably covering digital, customer or retail data science with experience in churn analytics, text analytics, customer segmentation, customer lifetime value model development and supporting operations.
Proficient with PowerBI, SQL, Python, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, or Pytorch.
Previous exposure to large language models or data governance/quality tools and techniques is considered a plus.
Able to build long-lasting relationships with peers in the organization based on trust.
Able to manage and coordinate the work of external resources, helping in the development of models and analysis.
Open minded to change and always seek to improve your way of working, knowledge and attitude.
A self-starter approach with the confidence to look beyond the ‚Äúhere and now‚Äù for the ‚Äúwhat could be‚Äù.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with conflicting time demands and multiple stakeholders
Have a strong inclination to data analysis combined with same attention to business impacts.
Possess strong analytical skills, mathematic abilities and critical thinking, a clear and open communication, relational and team building skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to share information.¬†
Excellent knowledge of Office package, with advanced expertise in Excel (pivot, macro, statistics formulas).
Working knowledge of code versioning and testing.
Nice to have: knowledge of Dataiku and GCP tools for data science.
Fluent in English

Title: Senior Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

Siamo alla ricerca di un Senior Deep Learning Engineer altamente qualificato per unirsi al nostro team di AI.

Il candidato ideale avr√† una solida esperienza in reti neurali, transformer e modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLM). Sar√† responsabile dello sviluppo di progetti innovativi che avranno come focus l‚Äôapplicazione di modelli pre-addestrati e del training end-to-end di reti neurali con architetture Encoder o Decoder.

Fineco √® rinomata per le sue soluzioni innovative nel settore bancario, offrendo servizi di conto corrente, carte di pagamento, investimenti e trading. Con un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo, Fineco √® al primo posto tra le banche italiane secondo Forbes.

Responsabilit√†


Progettare, sviluppare e implementare modelli di deep learning avanzati.
Eseguire il training end-to-end di reti neurali utilizzando architetture Encoder o Decoder.
Ottimizzare le prestazioni dei modelli e migliorare la loro efficienza.
Collaborare con altri team per integrare soluzioni di AI nei prodotti aziendali.
Mantenere aggiornate le conoscenze sulle ultime tecnologie e tendenze nel campo del deep learning.



Requirements


Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, o campo correlato.
Esperienza comprovata nello sviluppo e nel training di modelli di deep learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di reti neurali, transformer e LLM.
Esperienza con architetture Encoder e Decoder.
Esperienza documentata in ambito aziendale, preferibilmente bancario.
Capacit√† di analisi, implementazione e presentazione dei risultati a stakeholder business.
Esperienza con modelli di computer vision o multimodali.
Capacit√† di lavorare in modo indipendente e in team.
Eccellenti capacit√† di problem-solving e analitiche.
Buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python e framework di deep learning come PyTorch.



Other information

Cosa Offriamo


Opportunit√† di lavorare su progetti innovativi e all'avanguardia.
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo.
Opportunit√† di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
Pacchetto retributivo competitivo e benefit aziendali.



Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Il Gruppo Fineco √® orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversit√†, offrendo pari opportunit√† di lavoro. Fineco ‚ÄúThe Place To Be‚Äù

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
About CoreView




CoreView is the #1 Microsoft 365 management platform for IT teams who are transforming the way they run their Microsoft 365 stack. Simeon Cloud, a CoreView company, is a robust configuration as code solution for implementing governance and automation for modern digital workplaces using Microsoft 365. Combined, this suite of tools is the only platform on the market that provides a holistic approach to satisfy IT and business governance requirements for Microsoft 365, from internal policies to external regulations, and day-to-day operations.




Job Summary

CoreView is looking for a AI Engineer ‚ÄùGenAI Mechanic‚Äù. As a member of the AI development team, you'll channel your AI expertise, build smarter features using GenAI technologies, and guide the creation of exceptional user-centric and automated AI workflows.




At CoreView, we build tools that transform both our internal company workflows and our customer-facing product.




You'll work with AI frameworks like Agno, but we are open-minded about everything that is top-notch in the field. Our stack includes Qdrant and Postgres for blazing-fast searches and persistent storage. If you have a passion for GenAI and artificial intelligence and the drive to explore uncharted territories, CoreView is your stage to perform.




Job requirements

Enthusiastic about building intelligent and scalable solutions using cutting-edge GenAI technologies.
Strong understanding of GenAI‚Äôs role in distributed systems, conversational agents, and integration pipelines.
Proficient in Python, with experience in designing modular and agentic AI-driven tools and SDK.
Experience building autonomous systems with agentic frameworks like Agno, CrewAI, and LangChain.
Familiarity with vector databases like Qdrant and relational databases like PostgreSQL.
Dive deep into prompt engineering and optimization, focusing on high-quality AI-generated output.
Strong problem-solving skills with a passion for troubleshooting agentic frameworks and GenAI tooling.
Passion and curiosity for topics like fine-tuning, MLX, LLMStudio, and Ollama.
Proficient in English‚Äîcapable of collaborating across global teams.




Job responsibilities

Drive the software architecture for innovative GenAI-driven features, ensuring scalability, usability, and intelligence.
Develop core AI features leveraging GenAI frameworks for smart decision-making and personalized in-product experiences.
Build AI-powered tools to enhance internal development workflows and accelerate product innovation.
Optimize AI models and agent frameworks to respond faster and smarter.
Help internal engineers with AI topics, fostering an environment of growth, innovation, and AI excitement.
Enhance security and ethical AI practices within the product, ensuring compliance with industry guidelines.
Expand AI libraries, workflows, and tooling to boost engineering efficiency and maintainability.
Keep CoreView at the forefront of the GenAI and AI world by evaluating emerging technologies and integrating what‚Äôs relevant.




Additional Notes:

CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or any other protected group status.

Title: NEW Research Engineer GEM (GlobalQuakeModel)
Description:
Job Title

Research Engineer

Job Description

Primary duties for this position will be:

The development of open-source tools and software for probabilistic seismic hazard and risk assessment, in collaboration with the IT team

To support the creation of national, regional and global PSHA hazard models, in close collaboration with scientists working in different parts of the world

Active research into new theoretical concepts and computational techniques for the development and application of probabilistic seismic hazard.

Training scientists and students in both the use of the software as well as the scientific aspects of seismic hazard analysis

Restrictions


Telecommuting is OK
No Agencies Please


Requirements


Strong knowledge of computational programming for scientific applications. Our software (OpenQuake) is developed in Python and knowledge of the usual scientific stack (numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib, numba, ...) is expected.
Proven ability to work in a multidisciplinary team
Good oral and written communication skills
Strong multi-tasking and organisational skills
Ability to work collaboratively, openness to discussion and willingness to collaborate with the other members of the team
A PhD in one of the following STEM disciplines (or related) is not required by appreciated


About The Company

The Global Earthquake Model (GEM) is a global collaborative effort that brings together state-of-the-art science and national, regional and international organisations. GEM promotes the creation of open tools, models and datasets for the calculation of seismic hazard and risk. The GEM Hazard Team assembles and maintains global and regional earthquake databases, and develops and provides the capability to compute and analyse seismic hazard. Currently, the GEM Hazard Team actively develops the OpenQuake Engine (the GEM seismic hazard calculation engine) and several tools and applications for PSHA input model creation and testing, such as the OpenQuake Hazard Modeller‚Äôs Toolkit or the OpenQuake Model Building Toolkit. The team also collaborates with groups of scientists in different parts of the world involved in activities promoted by GEM.

Contact Info


Contact: Michele Simionato
E-mail contact: michele.simionato@gmail.com
Web: https://www.globalquakemodel.org/

Title: 12716 - Junior scientist or postdoctoral researcher in AI/ML for Climate Adaptation and Decision-Making
Company: CMCC Foundation - Centro Euro Mediterraneo sui Cambiamenti Climatici
Description:
CMCC Position cod. 12716
Junior scientist or postdoctoral researcher in AI/ML for Climate Adaptation and Decision-Making
Deadline: May 31th, 2025



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking 2 motivated and talented Junior Scientists or Postdoctoral Researchers to join our growing team in the field of AI and Machine Learning for climate adaptation and decision-making. This position is ideal for candidates with strong analytical and computational backgrounds who are passionate about developing innovative tools to support the design of resilient systems under deep uncertainty.
The successful candidate will contribute to the development of AI/ML methods applied to:

the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events (e.g., heatwaves, floods, droughts),
the emulation of complex Earth system and infrastructure models (climate-energy-water systems),
technological scenario generation and exploration via generative AI and reinforcement learning,
and the integration of these methods within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks.

The role involves both methodological innovation and application to real-world case studies, with a focus on supporting climate-resilient infrastructure design and planning.
We are particularly interested in candidates who can bridge the gap between data-driven AI techniques and physics-based modeling, and who are excited to work on interdisciplinary research that connects climate science, engineering, and decision analysis.


ABOUT US
CMCC Foundation is a cross-cutting scientific research center on climate change and its interactions with the environment, society, the world of business, and policymakers. Our work aims to stimulate sustainable growth, protect the environment, and develop strategies for the adaptation and mitigation of climate change. CMCC's core objective is to conduct cutting-edge science, to train the next generation of scientists at both national and international levels, and to be a beacon for climate modelling.

The European Institute in Economics and the Environment (EIEE) is one of the three institutes of CMCC. It was established in 2018 in a trans-Atlantic partnership with Resources for the Future (RFF). It is one of the leading research centers on climate economics, featuring a diverse and international team of economists and natural scientists.


CMCC pursues fundamental and applied science with utmost scientific integrity, prioritizing data-driven science and providing data, information, and research results that can support informed public debate and decision-making processes. To achieve climate research objectives at the highest international standards, we invest in training all our talents, and strive to create a workplace where everyone can excel.

At CMCC you will find a strong, professional environment. Join an inclusive community that values diversity, where every voice is heard and respected. Help foster a culture of innovation and societal change, where individuals from all backgrounds can thrive and succeed.

Over the last decade, CMCC has experienced extraordinary growth. We are now embarking on a new chapter of our journey that will further boost CMCC‚Äôs global position in climate change research‚Ä¶Together!

To learn more about this opportunity and submit your application, please refer to the following:



ROLE

The researcher(s) will work under the supervision of the Technologies for Climate Transition (TCT) Division Director and contribute to the development of novel AI/ML methods to support climate adaptation and resilient system design. The position emphasizes the application of reinforcement learning, emulation, and generative modeling techniques to climate-energy-water systems, with a strong focus on enabling decision-making under deep uncertainty.
The role includes the design and implementation of data-driven and hybrid modeling frameworks that integrate AI with domain knowledge to address complex challenges such as:

the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events,
the emulation of computationally intensive Earth system models,
and the generation and exploration of scenarios to support robust decision-making processes.

Particular emphasis will be placed on applying AI/ML approaches within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks, enabling the design of strategies that are resilient across diverse and uncertain futures. This position offers a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between climate science, artificial intelligence, and decision theory, contributing to the TCT Division‚Äôs mission of delivering evidence-based, adaptive solutions for sustainable development in a changing climate.

TCT is the third, new division of the European Institute on Economics and the Environment (EIEE). The candidate will support the development of the division within the overall strategy of the institute, leveraging the relation with existing research at EIEE.


RESPONSIBILITIES

The researcher(s) will:
Develop and apply AI/ML algorithms for predictive modeling of climate extremes and their compound effects on critical systems.
Design and train emulators for complex simulation models (e.g., climate, hydrology, energy systems) to enable faster exploration of decision spaces.
Integrate reinforcement learning and generative approaches for scenario discovery and adaptive decision support.
Contribute to the development of decision-support tools under deep uncertainty, including robust and adaptive planning approaches.
Contribute to scientific publications, project deliverables, and funding proposals.
Contribute to proposal writing and fundraising activities.
Communicate results through reports, academic publications, and presentations.
Mentor interns or junior team members, contributing to team capacity building.
Contribute to the objectives of the EIEE institute and to its methodological suite

REQUIREMENTS
PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent subjects.
Accuracy and excellent analytical skills.
Excellent programming skill in c++ and/or python, with experience in ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
Excellent written and spoken English.
Interest in interdisciplinary research and policy-relevant science.


DURATION, COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
The position will be based in Milan CMCC office.
The appointment period will be initially 12 months, renewable pending a positive evaluation. Tenure can be granted from 2 to 4 years after being appointed as a junior researcher.
Contract and gross salary will be based on qualifications and working experience and competitive with major research centers in Europe.
Welfare package, for minimum 12 months contract.
Flexible working time as per internal policies.
Support during the immigration process, if needed.
Please note that this opportunity will be issued both internally and externally.
Interviews will begin one month after the opening of the job call and will continue until the position is filled.
¬†

PROTECTED CATEGORY
Belonging to legally protected categories (ex L. 68/99) will constitute a preferential condition.
Some fiscal benefits could be applied for repatriated workers or foreign researchers/professors, having the requirements defined by Dlgs 147/2015 (for repatriates) or Dl 78/2010 (for foreigners).
CMCC is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status, and other legally protected characteristics. Please omit from your CV any data you or we might consider discriminatory.
This job announcement is an invitation to express interest in the above-mentioned CMCC Position.

HTML:
CMCC Position cod. 12716
Junior scientist or postdoctoral researcher in AI/ML for Climate Adaptation and Decision-Making
Deadline: May 31th, 2025



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking 2 motivated and talented Junior Scientists or Postdoctoral Researchers to join our growing team in the field of AI and Machine Learning for climate adaptation and decision-making. This position is ideal for candidates with strong analytical and computational backgrounds who are passionate about developing innovative tools to support the design of resilient systems under deep uncertainty.
The successful candidate will contribute to the development of AI/ML methods applied to:

  • the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events (e.g., heatwaves, floods, droughts),
  • the emulation of complex Earth system and infrastructure models (climate-energy-water systems),
  • technological scenario generation and exploration via generative AI and reinforcement learning,
  • and the integration of these methods within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks.

The role involves both methodological innovation and application to real-world case studies, with a focus on supporting climate-resilient infrastructure design and planning.
We are particularly interested in candidates who can bridge the gap between data-driven AI techniques and physics-based modeling, and who are excited to work on interdisciplinary research that connects climate science, engineering, and decision analysis.


 ABOUT US
CMCC Foundation is a cross-cutting scientific research center on climate change and its interactions with the environment, society, the world of business, and policymakers. Our work aims to stimulate sustainable growth, protect the environment, and develop strategies for the adaptation and mitigation of climate change. CMCC's core objective is to conduct cutting-edge science, to train the next generation of scientists at both national and international levels, and to be a beacon for climate modelling.

The European Institute in Economics and the Environment (EIEE) is one of the three institutes of CMCC. It was established in 2018 in a trans-Atlantic partnership with Resources for the Future (RFF). It is one of the leading research centers on climate economics, featuring a diverse and international team of economists and natural scientists.


CMCC pursues fundamental and applied science with utmost scientific integrity, prioritizing data-driven science and providing data, information, and research results that can support informed public debate and decision-making processes. To achieve climate research objectives at the highest international standards, we invest in training all our talents, and strive to create a workplace where everyone can excel.

At CMCC you will find a strong, professional environment. Join an inclusive community that values diversity, where every voice is heard and respected. Help foster a culture of innovation and societal change, where individuals from all backgrounds can thrive and succeed.

Over the last decade, CMCC has experienced extraordinary growth. We are now embarking on a new chapter of our journey that will further boost CMCC‚Äôs global position in climate change research‚Ä¶Together!

To learn more about this opportunity and submit your application, please refer to the following:



 ROLE

The researcher(s) will work under the supervision of the Technologies for Climate Transition (TCT) Division Director and contribute to the development of novel AI/ML methods to support climate adaptation and resilient system design. The position emphasizes the application of reinforcement learning, emulation, and generative modeling techniques to climate-energy-water systems, with a strong focus on enabling decision-making under deep uncertainty.
The role includes the design and implementation of data-driven and hybrid modeling frameworks that integrate AI with domain knowledge to address complex challenges such as:

  • the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events,
  • the emulation of computationally intensive Earth system models,
  • and the generation and exploration of scenarios to support robust decision-making processes.

Particular emphasis will be placed on applying AI/ML approaches within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks, enabling the design of strategies that are resilient across diverse and uncertain futures. This position offers a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between climate science, artificial intelligence, and decision theory, contributing to the TCT Division‚Äôs mission of delivering evidence-based, adaptive solutions for sustainable development in a changing climate.

TCT is the third, new division of the European Institute on Economics and the Environment (EIEE). The candidate will support the development of the division within the overall strategy of the institute, leveraging the relation with existing research at EIEE.


 RESPONSIBILITIES

The researcher(s) will:
  • Develop and apply AI/ML algorithms for predictive modeling of climate extremes and their compound effects on critical systems.
  • Design and train emulators for complex simulation models (e.g., climate, hydrology, energy systems) to enable faster exploration of decision spaces.
  • Integrate reinforcement learning and generative approaches for scenario discovery and adaptive decision support.
  • Contribute to the development of decision-support tools under deep uncertainty, including robust and adaptive planning approaches.
  • Contribute to scientific publications, project deliverables, and funding proposals.
  • Contribute to proposal writing and fundraising activities.
  • Communicate results through reports, academic publications, and presentations.
  • Mentor interns or junior team members, contributing to team capacity building.
  • Contribute to the objectives of the EIEE institute and to its methodological suite
REQUIREMENTS
  • PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent subjects.
  • Accuracy and excellent analytical skills.
  • Excellent programming skill in c++ and/or python, with experience in ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Interest in interdisciplinary research and policy-relevant science.

DURATION, COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
  • The position will be based in Milan CMCC office.
  • The appointment period will be initially 12 months, renewable pending a positive evaluation. Tenure can be granted from 2 to 4 years after being appointed as a junior researcher.
  • Contract and gross salary will be based on qualifications and working experience and competitive with major research centers in Europe.
  • Welfare package, for minimum 12 months contract.
  • Flexible working time as per internal policies.
  • Support during the immigration process, if needed.
  • Please note that this opportunity will be issued both internally and externally.
  • Interviews will begin one month after the opening of the job call and will continue until the position is filled.
 

PROTECTED CATEGORY
Belonging to legally protected categories (ex L. 68/99) will constitute a preferential condition.
Some fiscal benefits could be applied for repatriated workers or foreign researchers/professors, having the requirements defined by Dlgs 147/2015 (for repatriates) or Dl 78/2010 (for foreigners).
CMCC is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status, and other legally protected characteristics. Please omit from your CV any data you or we might consider discriminatory.
This job announcement is an invitation to express interest in the above-mentioned CMCC Position.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Researcher
Description:
AI Researcher




Solomei AI creates a new generation of websites, combining human creativity and advanced AI. Our platform leverages AI agents built on advanced AI technologies, enabling dynamic and effective content presentation. As we continue to grow, we're seeking talented individuals who are excited to innovate at the intersection of human creativity and artificial intelligence.







Complex Problems You‚Äôll Be Leading




- Drive creation and strategic curation of robust datasets for fine-tuning and distilling advanced AI models, ensuring quality and real-world applicability.

- Lead the design of scalable fine-tuning and knowledge distillation pipelines for LLMs (LLaMA, Mistral, Gemma), optimizing performance and deployment.







In This Role, You Will




- Oversee data validation strategy, pipeline scalability, and quality assurance.

- Innovate and execute advanced fine-tuning and distillation techniques (LoRA, QLoRA).

- Develop rigorous experimentation frameworks to benchmark and optimize model accuracy and efficiency.

- Guide AI tool development (generative and classification).

- Collaborate closely with LPU providers to optimize model performance and deployment.

- Collaborate with product teams, ensuring alignment of model development with technical and business goals.

- Own model validation strategies for robustness and deployment readiness.







You Are a Great Fit If You Have




- PhD or extensive Master's in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.

- 5+ years leading large-scale data initiatives, including pipeline architecture and quality assurance.

- Expertise in fine-tuning and knowledge distillation of transformer-based models (e.g., LLaMA, Mistral, Gemma).

- Advanced proficiency with PyTorch, Hugging Face, and cloud-based deployments.

- Proven leadership and independent project management skills.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
In Altitudo, brand di Arsenalia, avrai la possibilit√† di partecipare attivamente alla vita dell‚Äôazienda mettendo in gioco le tue competenze digitali e la tua creativit√†. Sarai inserito in un contesto smart, dinamico ed internazionale, che favorisce la collaborazione, valorizza i talenti, promuove l‚Äôautenticit√† e ne sviluppa le potenzialit√† attuando continui piani di crescita professionale.

‚ÄúCerchiamo un professionista che dia un contributo rilevante ai nostri ambiziosi progetti ad alto contenuto tecnologico‚Äù

Cosa ti aspetta



Svilupperai modelli predittivi e algoritmi di machine learning e deep learning, monitorando e ottimizzando le performance.
Collaborerai con i clienti per comprendere le loro esigenze e tradurle in soluzioni data-driven.
Lavorarerai con team di sviluppo per implementare soluzioni basate sui dati utilizzando Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric e Azure Machine Learning.
Parteciperai a progetti di ricerca e sviluppo per migliorare le tecniche di analisi.
Ti occuperai della creazione di report e visualizzazioni per presentare i risultati delle analisi.
Analizzerai grandi quantit√† di dati per estrarre informazioni utili.
Utilizzerai strumenti e tecnologie Microsoft per la gestione e l'analisi dei dati, come SQL Server e Azure SQL Database.
Svilupperai e farai l'ottimizzazione di prompt per modelli LLM o SLM per migliorare l'interazione e l'efficacia delle soluzioni AI.
Analizzerai grandi quantit√† di dati per estrarre informazioni utili utilizzando Azure Data Lake e Azure Synapse Analytics.
Lavorerai in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante che ti aiuter√† a crescere, con colleghe e colleghi in gamba e motivati.
Parteciperai a progetti aziendali innovativi che integrano tecnologie avanzate, inclusa l'intelligenza artificiale, per creare soluzioni all'avanguardia.



Requisiti minimi



Hai maturato un‚Äôesperienza di almeno 3 anni come Data Scientist o in un ruolo simile?
Hai maturato competenze solide in linguaggi di programmazione come Python?
Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e ottimizzazione di modelli di machine learning?
Conosci tecniche di prompt engineering per modelli di linguaggio naturale?
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di analizzare grandi quantit√† di dati e di estrarre informazioni utili?
Sei abituato a lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente con i clienti?
Hai curiosit√† verso nuove tecnologie?
Parli e scrivi bene in inglese (livello B2)?
Hai flessibilit√† nell‚Äôoperare in contesti nuovi ed in progetti differenti?
Sei disponibile a trasferte di breve e media durata?‚ÄØ



Potresti essere proprio la persona che stiamo cercando!

Title: Junior Software Engineer - Milano [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come Junior Software Engineer ‚Äì Associate


Your Perspectives

In PwC Digital Innovation ci occupiamo di realizzare progetti e prodotti con l'utilizzo di tecnologie all'avanguardia che abilitano nuovi servizi per il mercato. I punti di forza delle nostre soluzioni sono l'elevata qualit√† e il ridotto time to market, ottenuti utilizzando le metodologie Scrum e DevOps. Se ti piace la tecnologia e sei interessato ad applicarla a diversi settori di mercato, entra nel nostro team con il ruolo di Associate e avrai l'opportunit√† di:


  • Utilizzare tecnologie moderne apprendendone di nuove;
  • Lavorare in un contesto giovane e dinamico;
  • Conseguire certificazioni sulle maggiori tecnologie di mercato;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Seguire un percorso di carriera che ti permetter√† di acquisire competenze manageriali oltre che tecniche.


Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica;
  • Hai maturato un minimo di esperienza nell‚Äôambito di progettazione e sviluppo software con l‚Äôutilizzo di almeno una delle seguenti tecnologie: Angular, Java Spring Boot, NodeJS, Flutter;
  • Sei appassionato di tecnologia e consideri il linguaggio di sviluppo un mezzo per arrivare al tuo obiettivo;
  • Hai sviluppato capacit√† di ascolto attivo, di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Sei capace di lavorare in autonomia ove necessario;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza, curiosit√† e spiccato senso di responsabilit√† professionale;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprender√† con un‚Äôopportunit√† di carriera che ti far√† sentire al centro della societ√†, dell‚Äôinnovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.


Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversit√† e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Transportation Data Scientist
Description:
Job Posting Title

Transportation Data Scientist

The challenge

We are looking for a Transportation Data Scientist to be part of our Demand Management Platform in Haier Europe.

The position is located near Milano.

What You Will Do


Understanding of the business, demand and general supply chain processes, and data science related topics such as data systems and business reporting and KPIs,
He/she is responsible for building the data pipeline and automatize bottom up freight out statistical data extraction for a pool of markets/business sectors of finished products,
He/ she aims to improve the freight out bottom up allocation accuracy,
Produce actionable insights and send tangible data-driven recommendations to support the decision-making in the supply chain, transportation, and D2D
He/she interacts with people in different organizational units around the world, such as Branches, D2Ds, OTC, demand planning teams, Shipping Departments, as well as HQ, to execute freight out analytics requirements, defined by the manager and company,
Continuous improvement and improvements for the freight out calculation generation ,tracking KPIs
Independently perform end-to-end data science tasks (including data exploration, data cleaning, modeling, and data visualization) to support the digitalization initiatives in supply chain, and daily report generation


What You Need To Succeed

Must have

Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Bioinformatics, Applied Math, Finance or Engineering Departments

Professional experience: Having a 6 months of experience as a data scientist or analyst in a multinational organization

Language: Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English

Soft skills: Excellent analytical, relational and negotiation skills, and problem-solving skills

Other


Experience in data wrangling and predictive modeling using the open-source programming languages Python
Experience in querying databases using SQL
Ability to code and generate reporting in Python
Experience in creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks


Haier Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Clinical Research Scientist Chase
Description:
Job Description: CNS Clinical Project Manager

Position: Clinical Project Manager - CNS

Location: Milan, Italy

Employment Type: Full-Time

Industry: Biotechnology

Company Overview

Join a well-established and fully funded biotech company at the forefront of central nervous system (CNS) therapeutics. With an innovative pipeline targeting unmet medical needs in neurology and psychiatry, we are expanding our clinical operations team and are seeking a dedicated Clinical Project Manager (CPM) to oversee and drive our CNS clinical trials to success.

Key Responsibilities


Clinical Trial Oversight:
Plan, execute, and manage all phases of CNS clinical trials, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.
Oversee multiple trials simultaneously across international sites, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
Team Leadership:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including regulatory, data management, medical affairs, and external vendors.
Act as the primary point of contact between sponsors, investigators, and site staff to ensure effective communication.
Regulatory & Compliance:
Ensure all trials adhere to ICH-GCP guidelines, company SOPs, and relevant regulatory requirements.
Prepare and review essential regulatory documents and submissions to ethics committees and authorities.
Budget & Resource Management:
Develop, track, and manage clinical trial budgets, contracts, and resources.
Optimize resources to meet trial objectives efficiently.
Vendor and CRO Management:
Select, contract, and oversee third-party vendors, including CROs, ensuring quality deliverables and adherence to timelines.
Conduct regular performance reviews and risk assessments to maintain vendor accountability.
Site Management:
Lead site identification, initiation, and monitoring to ensure high-quality trial conduct.
Address site challenges proactively and implement corrective actions as needed.
Data Integrity and Reporting:
Ensure robust data collection, monitoring, and quality control processes.
Collaborate with biostatistics and data management teams for timely data analysis and reporting.
Required Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor's or advanced degree in life sciences, pharmacy, or a related field.
Experience:
5+ years in clinical trial/project management, with a strong focus on CNS therapeutic areas.
Proven track record of managing international multi-site trials.
Hands-on experience with all phases of clinical trials, especially Phase I-III.
Skills:
Deep understanding of CNS disorders and their clinical development challenges.
Strong organizational, leadership, and decision-making abilities.
Proficiency in project management tools and systems.
Fluent in English and Italian (both written and verbal).
Preferred Qualifications:


Prior experience in biotech or pharmaceutical CNS drug development.
Knowledge of emerging CNS therapies, biomarkers, or advanced trial designs.
Familiarity with Milan's clinical research ecosystem and key opinion leaders.


What We Offer:


An opportunity to work with a highly skilled and passionate team in a cutting-edge biotech environment.
Competitive salary, benefits, and performance-based incentives.
A collaborative culture fostering innovation and personal growth.
The chance to contribute to life-changing therapies for CNS disorders

Title: Data Science Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced data science engineer who wants to lend your expertise to train AI models? Join our team of experts to train AI models for data science generation!

We partner with organizations to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models improve their output. Projects typically involve predictive modeling, classification, clustering, optimization, a/b testing, and/or anomaly detection that require interacting with these models as they learn. No previous AI experience is required.

About The Opportunity

Outlier is looking for talented Data Scientists to help train generative artificial intelligence models.

This freelance opportunity is remote with flexible hours, so you can work whenever is best for you. The general expectation is 30-40 hours of availability per week.

You Can Contribute With Your Expertise By


Developing and answering data science questions to help train AI models
Evaluating and classifying responses generated by AI models


Examples Of Experience


Currently pursuing or having completed a bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Data Science from a selective institution.
Proficiency in working with Data Science
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in written and spoken English.
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.


If you already have an Outlier account, please apply here:

https://forms.gle/God6XYypiSpAxvrd6


Please apply only if you meet the required skills and have a strong interest in the role.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, store, and use personal data for our business purposes, including notifying you about opportunities that may be of interest to you and sharing it with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to what we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage the needs of applicants, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect related to your application will be handled in accordance with Outlier's Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Since this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to register with Outlier if you have a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor for specific questions about your circumstances.

Title: Lead Data Scientist & AI/ML Engineer
Description:

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - BUSINESS UNIT MERCATO
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Data Scientist all‚Äôinterno della struttura Data Office della Business Unit Mercato.¬†

La struttura svolge analisi avanzate sui dati con metodi di data science e machine learning, sviluppando e gestendo modelli di predizione, classificazione e segmentazione della Customer Base in grado di abilitare processi di business e promuovendo un approccio data driven che valorizzi il patrimonio informativo aziendale, favorendone l‚Äôintegrazione con diverse fonti interne e l‚Äôarricchimento con dati esterni. Analisi e modelli sono a supporto delle attivit√† commerciali ed operative delle societ√† della Business Unit Mercato, fra cui A2A Energia, NeN (Yada Energia), Energy Solutions, oltre ad altre societ√† controllate.

Per quale societ√†

L‚Äôinserimento avverr√†¬†in A2A S.p.A. per le attivit√† di Data Science della Business Unit Mercato che √® finalizzata alla vendita al dettaglio di energia elettrica e di gas naturale ai clienti del mercato libero e alla commercializzazione ai clienti serviti in regime di tutela. Inoltre, si occupa di fornire servizi di efficienza energetica e di mobilit√† elettrica.

Ti occuperai di


Data exploration & cleaning
Data enrichment da fonti dato esterne, sia strutturate che non strutturate
Analisi statistiche sui dati con l‚Äôobiettivo di ottenere insights utili al business
Supporto nelle diverse fasi di sviluppo di modelli di machine learning: feature selection & engineering, resampling & training, testing & cross validation, hyperparameters optimization, industrializzazione (MLops)
Valutazione delle prestazioni di modelli di machine learning


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in discipline matematiche, statistiche o ingegneristiche
Esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell‚Äôanalisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, TLC o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Esperienza in strumenti e tecniche di data exploration, data mining e machine learning
Conoscenza pratica dei linguaggi R e Python
Conoscenza pratica dei database relazionali e del linguaggio SQL
Conoscenza pratica di almeno una piattaforma cloud (GCP, AWS, MS Azure), con preferenza per Google Cloud Platform
Capacit√† di lettura e comprensione di documentazione tecnica in lingua inglese
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza dei principali strumenti di CI/CD (Docker, Git)
Completano il profilo: curiosit√†, attitudine all‚Äôapprendimento, proattivit√†, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla condivisione delle informazioni


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†:¬†settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto,¬†sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione della diversit√†.

La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Le nostre persone ¬†¬†https://t.ly/djoa3

Formazione ¬†¬†https://t.ly/Nr5Fr

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Quale sar√† la tua sfida?¬†

Bip ha creato all‚Äôinterno del proprio Competence Centre ‚ÄúxTech‚Äù il pi√π nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall‚ÄôItalia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere.¬†

Nell‚Äôambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale presso le realt√† enterprise pi√π importanti d‚ÄôItalia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 5 anni di esperienza). La provenienza da societ√† di consulenza direzionale o informatica sar√† considerata un forte plus.¬†

Il/La Data Scientist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze di AI e Machine Learning, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacit√† di tradurli in algoritmi e poi di comunicare e utilizzare i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi.¬†

In contesti pi√π semplificati in cui la componente di Data Engineering √® meno elaborata, i nostri Data Scientist procederanno in autonomia anche nella data preparation e nel porting in produzione dei modelli ingegnerizzati.¬†

Title: Artificial Intelligence Researcher
Description:
AI Researcher




Solomei AI creates a new generation of websites, combining human creativity and advanced AI. Our platform leverages AI agents built on advanced AI technologies, enabling dynamic and effective content presentation. As we continue to grow, we're seeking talented individuals who are excited to innovate at the intersection of human creativity and artificial intelligence.







Complex Problems You‚Äôll Be Leading




- Drive creation and strategic curation of robust datasets for fine-tuning and distilling advanced AI models, ensuring quality and real-world applicability.

- Lead the design of scalable fine-tuning and knowledge distillation pipelines for LLMs (LLaMA, Mistral, Gemma), optimizing performance and deployment.







In This Role, You Will




- Oversee data validation strategy, pipeline scalability, and quality assurance.

- Innovate and execute advanced fine-tuning and distillation techniques (LoRA, QLoRA).

- Develop rigorous experimentation frameworks to benchmark and optimize model accuracy and efficiency.

- Guide AI tool development (generative and classification).

- Collaborate closely with LPU providers to optimize model performance and deployment.

- Collaborate with product teams, ensuring alignment of model development with technical and business goals.

- Own model validation strategies for robustness and deployment readiness.







You Are a Great Fit If You Have




- PhD or extensive Master's in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.

- 5+ years leading large-scale data initiatives, including pipeline architecture and quality assurance.

- Expertise in fine-tuning and knowledge distillation of transformer-based models (e.g., LLaMA, Mistral, Gemma).

- Advanced proficiency with PyTorch, Hugging Face, and cloud-based deployments.

- Proven leadership and independent project management skills.
