Title: 12716 - Junior scientist or postdoctoral researcher in AI/ML for Climate Adaptation and Decision-Making
Company: CMCC Foundation - Centro Euro Mediterraneo sui Cambiamenti Climatici
Description:
CMCC Position cod. 12716
Junior scientist or postdoctoral researcher in AI/ML for Climate Adaptation and Decision-Making
Deadline: May 31th, 2025



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking 2 motivated and talented Junior Scientists or Postdoctoral Researchers to join our growing team in the field of AI and Machine Learning for climate adaptation and decision-making. This position is ideal for candidates with strong analytical and computational backgrounds who are passionate about developing innovative tools to support the design of resilient systems under deep uncertainty.
The successful candidate will contribute to the development of AI/ML methods applied to:

the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events (e.g., heatwaves, floods, droughts),
the emulation of complex Earth system and infrastructure models (climate-energy-water systems),
technological scenario generation and exploration via generative AI and reinforcement learning,
and the integration of these methods within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks.

The role involves both methodological innovation and application to real-world case studies, with a focus on supporting climate-resilient infrastructure design and planning.
We are particularly interested in candidates who can bridge the gap between data-driven AI techniques and physics-based modeling, and who are excited to work on interdisciplinary research that connects climate science, engineering, and decision analysis.


ABOUT US
CMCC Foundation is a cross-cutting scientific research center on climate change and its interactions with the environment, society, the world of business, and policymakers. Our work aims to stimulate sustainable growth, protect the environment, and develop strategies for the adaptation and mitigation of climate change. CMCC's core objective is to conduct cutting-edge science, to train the next generation of scientists at both national and international levels, and to be a beacon for climate modelling.

The European Institute in Economics and the Environment (EIEE) is one of the three institutes of CMCC. It was established in 2018 in a trans-Atlantic partnership with Resources for the Future (RFF). It is one of the leading research centers on climate economics, featuring a diverse and international team of economists and natural scientists.


CMCC pursues fundamental and applied science with utmost scientific integrity, prioritizing data-driven science and providing data, information, and research results that can support informed public debate and decision-making processes. To achieve climate research objectives at the highest international standards, we invest in training all our talents, and strive to create a workplace where everyone can excel.

At CMCC you will find a strong, professional environment. Join an inclusive community that values diversity, where every voice is heard and respected. Help foster a culture of innovation and societal change, where individuals from all backgrounds can thrive and succeed.

Over the last decade, CMCC has experienced extraordinary growth. We are now embarking on a new chapter of our journey that will further boost CMCC‚Äôs global position in climate change research‚Ä¶Together!

To learn more about this opportunity and submit your application, please refer to the following:



ROLE

The researcher(s) will work under the supervision of the Technologies for Climate Transition (TCT) Division Director and contribute to the development of novel AI/ML methods to support climate adaptation and resilient system design. The position emphasizes the application of reinforcement learning, emulation, and generative modeling techniques to climate-energy-water systems, with a strong focus on enabling decision-making under deep uncertainty.
The role includes the design and implementation of data-driven and hybrid modeling frameworks that integrate AI with domain knowledge to address complex challenges such as:

the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events,
the emulation of computationally intensive Earth system models,
and the generation and exploration of scenarios to support robust decision-making processes.

Particular emphasis will be placed on applying AI/ML approaches within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks, enabling the design of strategies that are resilient across diverse and uncertain futures. This position offers a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between climate science, artificial intelligence, and decision theory, contributing to the TCT Division‚Äôs mission of delivering evidence-based, adaptive solutions for sustainable development in a changing climate.

TCT is the third, new division of the European Institute on Economics and the Environment (EIEE). The candidate will support the development of the division within the overall strategy of the institute, leveraging the relation with existing research at EIEE.


RESPONSIBILITIES

The researcher(s) will:
Develop and apply AI/ML algorithms for predictive modeling of climate extremes and their compound effects on critical systems.
Design and train emulators for complex simulation models (e.g., climate, hydrology, energy systems) to enable faster exploration of decision spaces.
Integrate reinforcement learning and generative approaches for scenario discovery and adaptive decision support.
Contribute to the development of decision-support tools under deep uncertainty, including robust and adaptive planning approaches.
Contribute to scientific publications, project deliverables, and funding proposals.
Contribute to proposal writing and fundraising activities.
Communicate results through reports, academic publications, and presentations.
Mentor interns or junior team members, contributing to team capacity building.
Contribute to the objectives of the EIEE institute and to its methodological suite

REQUIREMENTS
PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent subjects.
Accuracy and excellent analytical skills.
Excellent programming skill in c++ and/or python, with experience in ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
Excellent written and spoken English.
Interest in interdisciplinary research and policy-relevant science.


DURATION, COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
The position will be based in Milan CMCC office.
The appointment period will be initially 12 months, renewable pending a positive evaluation. Tenure can be granted from 2 to 4 years after being appointed as a junior researcher.
Contract and gross salary will be based on qualifications and working experience and competitive with major research centers in Europe.
Welfare package, for minimum 12 months contract.
Flexible working time as per internal policies.
Support during the immigration process, if needed.
Please note that this opportunity will be issued both internally and externally.
Interviews will begin one month after the opening of the job call and will continue until the position is filled.
¬†

PROTECTED CATEGORY
Belonging to legally protected categories (ex L. 68/99) will constitute a preferential condition.
Some fiscal benefits could be applied for repatriated workers or foreign researchers/professors, having the requirements defined by Dlgs 147/2015 (for repatriates) or Dl 78/2010 (for foreigners).
CMCC is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status, and other legally protected characteristics. Please omit from your CV any data you or we might consider discriminatory.
This job announcement is an invitation to express interest in the above-mentioned CMCC Position.

HTML:
CMCC Position cod. 12716
Junior scientist or postdoctoral researcher in AI/ML for Climate Adaptation and Decision-Making
Deadline: May 31th, 2025



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking 2 motivated and talented Junior Scientists or Postdoctoral Researchers to join our growing team in the field of AI and Machine Learning for climate adaptation and decision-making. This position is ideal for candidates with strong analytical and computational backgrounds who are passionate about developing innovative tools to support the design of resilient systems under deep uncertainty.
The successful candidate will contribute to the development of AI/ML methods applied to:

  • the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events (e.g., heatwaves, floods, droughts),
  • the emulation of complex Earth system and infrastructure models (climate-energy-water systems),
  • technological scenario generation and exploration via generative AI and reinforcement learning,
  • and the integration of these methods within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks.

The role involves both methodological innovation and application to real-world case studies, with a focus on supporting climate-resilient infrastructure design and planning.
We are particularly interested in candidates who can bridge the gap between data-driven AI techniques and physics-based modeling, and who are excited to work on interdisciplinary research that connects climate science, engineering, and decision analysis.


 ABOUT US
CMCC Foundation is a cross-cutting scientific research center on climate change and its interactions with the environment, society, the world of business, and policymakers. Our work aims to stimulate sustainable growth, protect the environment, and develop strategies for the adaptation and mitigation of climate change. CMCC's core objective is to conduct cutting-edge science, to train the next generation of scientists at both national and international levels, and to be a beacon for climate modelling.

The European Institute in Economics and the Environment (EIEE) is one of the three institutes of CMCC. It was established in 2018 in a trans-Atlantic partnership with Resources for the Future (RFF). It is one of the leading research centers on climate economics, featuring a diverse and international team of economists and natural scientists.


CMCC pursues fundamental and applied science with utmost scientific integrity, prioritizing data-driven science and providing data, information, and research results that can support informed public debate and decision-making processes. To achieve climate research objectives at the highest international standards, we invest in training all our talents, and strive to create a workplace where everyone can excel.

At CMCC you will find a strong, professional environment. Join an inclusive community that values diversity, where every voice is heard and respected. Help foster a culture of innovation and societal change, where individuals from all backgrounds can thrive and succeed.

Over the last decade, CMCC has experienced extraordinary growth. We are now embarking on a new chapter of our journey that will further boost CMCC‚Äôs global position in climate change research‚Ä¶Together!

To learn more about this opportunity and submit your application, please refer to the following:



 ROLE

The researcher(s) will work under the supervision of the Technologies for Climate Transition (TCT) Division Director and contribute to the development of novel AI/ML methods to support climate adaptation and resilient system design. The position emphasizes the application of reinforcement learning, emulation, and generative modeling techniques to climate-energy-water systems, with a strong focus on enabling decision-making under deep uncertainty.
The role includes the design and implementation of data-driven and hybrid modeling frameworks that integrate AI with domain knowledge to address complex challenges such as:

  • the characterization and forecasting of extreme climate events,
  • the emulation of computationally intensive Earth system models,
  • and the generation and exploration of scenarios to support robust decision-making processes.

Particular emphasis will be placed on applying AI/ML approaches within robust decision-making (RDM) frameworks, enabling the design of strategies that are resilient across diverse and uncertain futures. This position offers a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between climate science, artificial intelligence, and decision theory, contributing to the TCT Division‚Äôs mission of delivering evidence-based, adaptive solutions for sustainable development in a changing climate.

TCT is the third, new division of the European Institute on Economics and the Environment (EIEE). The candidate will support the development of the division within the overall strategy of the institute, leveraging the relation with existing research at EIEE.


 RESPONSIBILITIES

The researcher(s) will:
  • Develop and apply AI/ML algorithms for predictive modeling of climate extremes and their compound effects on critical systems.
  • Design and train emulators for complex simulation models (e.g., climate, hydrology, energy systems) to enable faster exploration of decision spaces.
  • Integrate reinforcement learning and generative approaches for scenario discovery and adaptive decision support.
  • Contribute to the development of decision-support tools under deep uncertainty, including robust and adaptive planning approaches.
  • Contribute to scientific publications, project deliverables, and funding proposals.
  • Contribute to proposal writing and fundraising activities.
  • Communicate results through reports, academic publications, and presentations.
  • Mentor interns or junior team members, contributing to team capacity building.
  • Contribute to the objectives of the EIEE institute and to its methodological suite
REQUIREMENTS
  • PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent subjects.
  • Accuracy and excellent analytical skills.
  • Excellent programming skill in c++ and/or python, with experience in ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Interest in interdisciplinary research and policy-relevant science.

DURATION, COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
  • The position will be based in Milan CMCC office.
  • The appointment period will be initially 12 months, renewable pending a positive evaluation. Tenure can be granted from 2 to 4 years after being appointed as a junior researcher.
  • Contract and gross salary will be based on qualifications and working experience and competitive with major research centers in Europe.
  • Welfare package, for minimum 12 months contract.
  • Flexible working time as per internal policies.
  • Support during the immigration process, if needed.
  • Please note that this opportunity will be issued both internally and externally.
  • Interviews will begin one month after the opening of the job call and will continue until the position is filled.
 

PROTECTED CATEGORY
Belonging to legally protected categories (ex L. 68/99) will constitute a preferential condition.
Some fiscal benefits could be applied for repatriated workers or foreign researchers/professors, having the requirements defined by Dlgs 147/2015 (for repatriates) or Dl 78/2010 (for foreigners).
CMCC is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status, and other legally protected characteristics. Please omit from your CV any data you or we might consider discriminatory.
This job announcement is an invitation to express interest in the above-mentioned CMCC Position.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About us

Sibill is the accounting and financial operating system for small and medium businesses (SMBs).

Italy is the single largest EU country by number of SMBs. Italian SMBs employ 75% of workforce and generate two thirds of the country GDP. We want to unlock Italian SMBs productivity. Old tooling, manual processes, sparse data cause an average 8 hours/week wasted by our entrepreneurs. It simply can‚Äôt keep being as it is. Sibill gives this time back to entrepreneurs by bringing invoicing, payments, treasury and accounting in a single, modern platform.

International venture capital investors like Keen Venture Partners (Fiscozen), Founders A/S (Pleo), Exor Ventures (Qonto, Alan),¬†Notion Capital - and many others - believe in our mission and pledged their capital to make it happen.

We are a product-driven company with a pragmatic approach to solve real problems. We count several thousands of entrepreneurs as customers. We want to get to millions - this is just the beginning.




What we look for

We are looking for a motivated, pragmatic, and goal-oriented Senior Data Scientist to join our Data team.




You are the perfect fit if...

You are passionate about technology, statistics and business. The three of them.
You don‚Äôt feel ‚Äúdone‚Äù yet, you want to keep learning and applying science to drive business outcome. You still want to be hands-on.
You are excited about working in a flat, no-politics, fast-paced environment.
You have excellent analytical skills and and a sharp eye for detail.
You are not scared of working hard. As a team, we all have to go the extra-mile to make it happen.
You feel like fitting the values we share at Sibill: ambition, pragmatism, efficiency, integrity




What you will do

You will report directly to the chief data officer/ co-founder. You will work with him and build all the data products that empower our customers to run their business better. This will not be a one-man standing. It will take a lot of cross-functional work with the people in our data, engineering, product, design teams.

We sit on top of the most business-critical company data. Money flows, bank transactions, invoices, cash register records, payables and receivables, general ledger records. We are the accounting & finance operating system of our customers. You will build data products that use this vast information set to solve specific customer problems.

Your responsibilities will include:

Discovery, domain understanding, data collection and experimentation
Model development (training / test / validation)
Performance monitoring and iteration over existing data products

Examples of projects you could work on from month one at Sibill:

Refining our autoreconciliation search algorithm (matching invoices with related financial money flows) to try and improve f-score.
Building a classification model to label general ledger records with the right chart of accounts codes.




What you will need

M.Sc./Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related STEM field. You won‚Äôt be asked to send rockets to Mars - but a solid background in probability, stats, linear algebra and computational mathematics will give you an edge.
Modern Python and modern software development tools (Docker, CI/CD, unit testing, evals). We do not run data pipelines built on Jupyter Notebooks in production. Bonus point if you know you way around vector stores.
Proven expertise in leading model development using a wide range of techniques. Previous expertise in domains with high usage of neural networks (NLP, computer vision) is highly beneficial.
Especially at the beginning, an end-to-end data ownership mindset. It will not happen every day but - if necessary - you might be asked to build your own data pipeline end-to-end, to write a batch ETL, to write Elixir or TypeScript code, or to support teammates with an important one-off empirical analysis.
Fluency in English and Italian.
Bonus point: at least 7-8 years of experience. You have already coached and mentored junior colleagues.




Comp & Benefits

RAL: 70-90k
Employee stock options
Health insurance (AON)
Lunch voucher (8‚Ç¨/business day)
Full remote (based in Italy). We will just ask you to come to Milan for a few weeks during the onboarding (trip is on us)
You will work within a team of smart, hard-worker, passionate and nice human beings. People in Sibill tend to be very happy. Happiness is an underrated benefit ;-)




Recruiting process

30 minutes ‚Äúknow-each-other‚Äù session with Dario (Chief Data Officer)
45 minutes technical interview
you will meet some of the key people you will work with (engineering, data, product)
45 minutes with Mattia (CEO) and Lorenzo (Chief Product Officer)




Apply here --> https://sibill.notion.site/senior-data-scientist

Title: Clinical Research Scientist Chase
Description:
Job Description: CNS Clinical Project Manager

Position: Clinical Project Manager ‚Äì CNS

Location: Milan, Italy

Employment Type: Full-Time

Industry: Biotechnology

Company Overview

Join a well-established and fully funded biotech company at the forefront of central nervous system (CNS) therapeutics. With an innovative pipeline targeting unmet medical needs in neurology and psychiatry, we are expanding our clinical operations team and are seeking a dedicated Clinical Project Manager (CPM) to oversee and drive our CNS clinical trials to success.

Key Responsibilities


Clinical Trial Oversight:
Plan, execute, and manage all phases of CNS clinical trials, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.
Oversee multiple trials simultaneously across international sites, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
Team Leadership:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including regulatory, data management, medical affairs, and external vendors.
Act as the primary point of contact between sponsors, investigators, and site staff to ensure effective communication.
Regulatory & Compliance:
Ensure all trials adhere to ICH-GCP guidelines, company SOPs, and relevant regulatory requirements.
Prepare and review essential regulatory documents and submissions to ethics committees and authorities.
Budget & Resource Management:
Develop, track, and manage clinical trial budgets, contracts, and resources.
Optimize resources to meet trial objectives efficiently.
Vendor and CRO Management:
Select, contract, and oversee third-party vendors, including CROs, ensuring quality deliverables and adherence to timelines.
Conduct regular performance reviews and risk assessments to maintain vendor accountability.
Site Management:
Lead site identification, initiation, and monitoring to ensure high-quality trial conduct.
Address site challenges proactively and implement corrective actions as needed.
Data Integrity and Reporting:
Ensure robust data collection, monitoring, and quality control processes.
Collaborate with biostatistics and data management teams for timely data analysis and reporting.

Required Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree in life sciences, pharmacy, or a related field.
Experience:
5+ years in clinical trial/project management, with a strong focus on CNS therapeutic areas.
Proven track record of managing international multi-site trials.
Hands-on experience with all phases of clinical trials, especially Phase I-III.
Skills:
Deep understanding of CNS disorders and their clinical development challenges.
Strong organizational, leadership, and decision-making abilities.
Proficiency in project management tools and systems.
Fluent in English and Italian (both written and verbal).

Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience in biotech or pharmaceutical CNS drug development.
Knowledge of emerging CNS therapies, biomarkers, or advanced trial designs.
Familiarity with Milan‚Äôs clinical research ecosystem and key opinion leaders.


What We Offer


An opportunity to work with a highly skilled and passionate team in a cutting-edge biotech environment.
Competitive salary, benefits, and performance-based incentives.
A collaborative culture fostering innovation and personal growth.
The chance to contribute to life-changing therapies for CNS disorders

Title: Senior Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

Siamo alla ricerca di un Senior Deep Learning Engineer altamente qualificato per unirsi al nostro team di AI.

Il candidato ideale avr√† una solida esperienza in reti neurali, transformer e modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLM). Sar√† responsabile dello sviluppo di progetti innovativi che avranno come focus l‚Äôapplicazione di modelli pre-addestrati e del training end-to-end di reti neurali con architetture Encoder o Decoder.

Fineco √® rinomata per le sue soluzioni innovative nel settore bancario, offrendo servizi di conto corrente, carte di pagamento, investimenti e trading. Con un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo, Fineco √® al primo posto tra le banche italiane secondo Forbes.

Responsabilit√†


Progettare, sviluppare e implementare modelli di deep learning avanzati.
Eseguire il training end-to-end di reti neurali utilizzando architetture Encoder o Decoder.
Ottimizzare le prestazioni dei modelli e migliorare la loro efficienza.
Collaborare con altri team per integrare soluzioni di AI nei prodotti aziendali.
Mantenere aggiornate le conoscenze sulle ultime tecnologie e tendenze nel campo del deep learning.



Requirements


Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, o campo correlato.
Esperienza comprovata nello sviluppo e nel training di modelli di deep learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di reti neurali, transformer e LLM.
Esperienza con architetture Encoder e Decoder.
Esperienza documentata in ambito aziendale, preferibilmente bancario.
Capacit√† di analisi, implementazione e presentazione dei risultati a stakeholder business.
Esperienza con modelli di computer vision o multimodali.
Capacit√† di lavorare in modo indipendente e in team.
Eccellenti capacit√† di problem-solving e analitiche.
Buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python e framework di deep learning come PyTorch.



Other information

Cosa Offriamo


Opportunit√† di lavorare su progetti innovativi e all'avanguardia.
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo.
Opportunit√† di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
Pacchetto retributivo competitivo e benefit aziendali.



Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Il Gruppo Fineco √® orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversit√†, offrendo pari opportunit√† di lavoro. Fineco ‚ÄúThe Place To Be‚Äù

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
In Altitudo, brand di Arsenalia, avrai la possibilit√† di partecipare attivamente alla vita dell‚Äôazienda mettendo in gioco le tue competenze digitali e la tua creativit√†. Sarai inserito in un contesto smart, dinamico ed internazionale, che favorisce la collaborazione, valorizza i talenti, promuove l‚Äôautenticit√† e ne sviluppa le potenzialit√† attuando continui piani di crescita professionale.

‚ÄúCerchiamo un professionista che dia un contributo rilevante ai nostri ambiziosi progetti ad alto contenuto tecnologico‚Äù

Cosa ti aspetta

Title: Transportation Data Scientist
Description:
Job Posting Title

Transportation Data Scientist

The challenge

We are looking for a Transportation Data Scientist to be part of our Demand Management Platform in Haier Europe.

The position is located near Milano.

What You Will Do


Understanding of the business, demand and general supply chain processes, and data science related topics such as data systems and business reporting and KPIs,
He/she is responsible for building the data pipeline and automatize bottom up freight out statistical data extraction for a pool of markets/business sectors of finished products,
He/ she aims to improve the freight out bottom up allocation accuracy,
Produce actionable insights and send tangible data-driven recommendations to support the decision-making in the supply chain, transportation, and D2D
He/she interacts with people in different organizational units around the world, such as Branches, D2Ds, OTC, demand planning teams, Shipping Departments, as well as HQ, to execute freight out analytics requirements, defined by the manager and company,
Continuous improvement and improvements for the freight out calculation generation ,tracking KPIs
Independently perform end-to-end data science tasks (including data exploration, data cleaning, modeling, and data visualization) to support the digitalization initiatives in supply chain, and daily report generation


What You Need To Succeed

Must have

Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Bioinformatics, Applied Math, Finance or Engineering Departments

Professional experience: Having a 6 months of experience as a data scientist or analyst in a multinational organization

Language: Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English

Soft skills: Excellent analytical, relational and negotiation skills, and problem-solving skills

Other


Experience in data wrangling and predictive modeling using the open-source programming languages Python
Experience in querying databases using SQL
Ability to code and generate reporting in Python
Experience in creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks


Haier Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.

Strumenti Big Data (Spark, Kafka, etc.).

Google Cloud Platform, Airflow e Python.

Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.

Preferibile certificazione Google Professional Machine Learning Engineer.









Benefit:

Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida con flessibilit√† smart working.

Percorsi di crescita e sviluppo professionale..

Spazio di lavoro immerso nella natura nelle Marche, aperto anche a familiari e amici.

Iniziative di sostenibilit√† e impatto sociale.

Title: AI Engineer - Google
Description:
Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Il nostro team di Artificial Intelligence Engineering che lavora verticalmente su piattaforme Google Cloud (GCP) si impegna a supportare i clienti nel percorso di adozione dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale attraverso la realizzazione di factory di soluzioni di AI, azionabili e integrate nell'architettura e nei processi aziendali.

La figura dell‚ÄôAI Engineer progetta soluzioni software di Machine Learning (ML) scalabili per i casi d'uso dei clienti e le industrializza per l‚Äôesecuzione in produzione garantendo i livelli richiesti di performance, sicurezza e governabilit√†.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer lavora a stretto contatto con altre figure di Bip xTech, come Cloud Data Architects, Data Scientists e Data Engineer, per realizzare soluzioni ML di alta qualit√† sotto ogni aspetto: disegnando e implementando per il team strumenti di lavoro come le piattaforme di MLOps, fornendo linee guida e best practise sulle architetture dati e di AI, supportando l‚Äôimplementazione del software e funzionalit√† di osservabilit√† dell‚ÄôAI, e altro ancora.

Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?

¬†Requisiti fondamentali


Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM);
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo della piattaforma Google Cloud;
Esperienza nello sviluppo di software in almeno un linguaggio, come per esempio: Python, Scala, Java, e/o simili;
Esperienza nel disegno di soluzioni software e nell‚Äôimplementazione di strutture dati, algoritmi;
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo degli strumenti di Code Repository, come per esempio: GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps e/o simili.
Conoscenza dei concetti, algoritmi e metodologie di Machine Learning.
Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per il design, query e gestione dei database; esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di linguaggi SQL per le attivit√† di ETL.
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di Italiano e Inglese professionali.


Plus


Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo delle piattaforme cloud (esempio: Google, AWS, Azure);
Conoscenza dei concetti e tecnologie di Big Data e Data Warehousing (esempio: Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Kafka);
Esperienza con framework e metodologie di Deep Learning (esempio: Tensorflow, Torch, Caffe, Theano).


¬†

Perch√® Bip?

People at¬†the¬†center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.¬†

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking¬†fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 ‚Äì.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L‚Äôiter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di¬†lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

HTML:
Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Il nostro team di Artificial Intelligence Engineering che lavora verticalmente su piattaforme Google Cloud (GCP) si impegna a supportare i clienti nel percorso di adozione dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale attraverso la realizzazione di factory di soluzioni di AI, azionabili e integrate nell'architettura e nei processi aziendali.

La figura dell‚ÄôAI Engineer progetta soluzioni software di Machine Learning (ML) scalabili per i casi d'uso dei clienti e le industrializza per l‚Äôesecuzione in produzione garantendo i livelli richiesti di performance, sicurezza e governabilit√†.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer lavora a stretto contatto con altre figure di Bip xTech, come Cloud Data Architects, Data Scientists e Data Engineer, per realizzare soluzioni ML di alta qualit√† sotto ogni aspetto: disegnando e implementando per il team strumenti di lavoro come le piattaforme di MLOps, fornendo linee guida e best practise sulle architetture dati e di AI, supportando l‚Äôimplementazione del software e funzionalit√† di osservabilit√† dell‚ÄôAI, e altro ancora.

Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?

 Requisiti fondamentali
  • Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo della piattaforma Google Cloud;
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di software in almeno un linguaggio, come per esempio: Python, Scala, Java, e/o simili;
  • Esperienza nel disegno di soluzioni software e nell‚Äôimplementazione di strutture dati, algoritmi;
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo degli strumenti di Code Repository, come per esempio: GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps e/o simili.
  • Conoscenza dei concetti, algoritmi e metodologie di Machine Learning.
  • Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per il design, query e gestione dei database; esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di linguaggi SQL per le attivit√† di ETL.
  • Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di Italiano e Inglese professionali.


Plus
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo delle piattaforme cloud (esempio: Google, AWS, Azure);
  • Conoscenza dei concetti e tecnologie di Big Data e Data Warehousing (esempio: Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Kafka);
  • Esperienza con framework e metodologie di Deep Learning (esempio: Tensorflow, Torch, Caffe, Theano).


 

Perch√® Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.

Title: Data Scientist Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, √® tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con pi√π di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicit√†, talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l‚Äôascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorit√†. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunit√† e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Data Scientist in NTT DATA will have a mix of skills including Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise) engineering best practices, statistical expertise, Machine and Deep Learning skills and a strong business sense.

The Senior Data Scientist will work with fellow data scientists, data engineers, ML Engineers, product managers, business analysts, and stakeholders from other internal groups and from external clients.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the Data Scientists and connecting with the stakeholders on client?s side, to ensure that tasks are on time and well executed.

Required Skills

  • Experience of at least 3-5 years as data scientist;
  • Strong Python (mandatory) and SQL coding;
  • Knowledge of Java/Scala or C++/R is a plus;
  • Tensorflow and Pytorch knowledge with a focus over Computer Vision solutions;
  • Knowledge of ML solutions architecture and Generative AI pipelines;
  • Cloud and hybrid ML implementations;
  • Incorporate new, cutting edge business intelligence, machine learning, and alternative data practices into wider organization to drive efficiencies and generate revenue;
  • Own the full stack execution of data science projects from data wrangling, model development, presentation, measurement to deployment;
  • Work with data engineers to produce fully productionized pipelines including data ingestion, cleaning, feature engineering and model training/prediction;
  • Conduct research and analysis into reinsurance and advisory products to augment industry-standard models and develop new market offerings;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üöÄ Join Movify ‚Äì Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don‚Äôt just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




ü§† What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company‚Äôs data strategy and best practices




ü§ì Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




üòç Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Opleidingsniveau: WO / Master opleiding

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM‚Äôs and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM‚Äôs (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We're partnered with a VC-backed climate tech startup whose mission is to drive climate action through data. Their intelligent platform empowers organisations to tackle climate issues by monitoring their carbon footprint. It's currently being used by global sustainability leaders!




On the hunt for TWO talented Machine Learning Engineers with experience in Search, Recommendation Engines, and Text Classification to join our dynamic team. You'll collaborate with developers, scientists, and experts to improve AI features that are at the core of what we do. If you're someone who loves taking ownership of projects and working in a team, this could be a great fit for you!




What you‚Äôll do:

Build, develop, and maintain ML models, NLP, and Information Retrieval systems that power carbon intelligence globally.
Deliver key data and insights through platforms that support major enterprises in their climate action efforts.
Experiment and optimize models (like transformers, classifiers, LLMs) to improve our product‚Äôs search and recommendation engine.
Keep our data pipelines in check, ensuring everything‚Äôs ready for modeling.
Deploy and manage models using AWS SageMaker, Flask, and Pydantic.




What you‚Äôll need:

Extensive experience in Machine Learning, specifically with Search, Classification, and Information Retrieval.
Python experience, specifically working with data pipelines and REST APIs.
A self-starter who enjoys problem-solving and working independently.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with remote teams.




What's in it for you?:

Genuinely making a positive impact on the planet
Salary ‚Ç¨100K-120K
Benefits, including employee stock options
As a remote-first company, their team collaborates from locations across Europe.




If this is of interest to you, please apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sibling is looking for a Data Scientist for a leading insurer in Brussels, Belgium. This will be a long-term freelance assignment.




Role




Designing, developing, and implementing AI/data-driven solutions tailored to business needs using internal and external data.
Extracting and communicating actionable insights to support decision-making and problem-solving.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.
Continuously monitoring model accuracy and proactively identifying and fixing issues or data drifts.




Skills




At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, ideally within a commercial/business context.
Hands-on expertise in AI, GenAI, computer vision, NLP, and/or deep learning.
Advanced skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, and Databricks.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì you can clearly present complex data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, and English.
Hybrid Working




Please, get in touch

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist ‚Äì 6 months extendable contract - Remote - Pharma




We are looking Data Scientist with practical expertise in Snowflake, Databricks, and advanced data preparation techniques. The ideal candidate will have experience with Generative AI (GenAI) initiatives, especially those focused on predictive modeling of customer journeys or Intelligent Digital Companion (IDC) applications.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and implement predictive models to forecast user behaviour and customer journey patterns.
Leverage Snowflake and Databricks to prepare, transform, and analyse large-scale datasets.
Apply GenAI methodologies‚Äîsuch as embeddings and large language models (LLMs)‚Äîto drive personalization and engagement.
Work closely with ML engineers, MLOps specialists, and product teams to align data science solutions with business goals.
Translate analytical insights and models into actionable strategies that enhance the customer experience.




Required Skills:




Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data analysis/modeling tools.
Hands-on experience with data wrangling in Snowflake and Databricks.
Knowledge of GenAI/LLMs, vector databases, or NLP-based customer journey modeling.
Ability to handle structured and unstructured data from diverse sources.




Preferred Qualifications:




Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience with MLOps and model deployment workflows.
Domain knowledge in pharmaceuticals, e-commerce, or customer analytics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client‚Äôs needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client‚Äôs needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)‚Ä¶
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java ‚Ä¶
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector ‚Äì Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients ‚Äî a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)‚Äî we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üíºJob Title: Data Scientist

üë®‚ÄçüíªJob Type: Contract/Freelance

üìçLocation: Brussels, Belgium

üíºWork regime: Hybrid (2-3 Day Onsite in a Week)

üî•Keywords: Python and grid structure, localization of electrical generation and consumption, etc.










What you will be doing

We are hiring a highly organized and detail oriented senior data scientist to support the industrialization of existing scripts, as well as the inclusion of new functionalities & a full migration to Python. The ideal candidate would be responsible for the full development process, including efficient programming, discussing functionalities with business experts, maintaining code & user documentation, all while ensuring a timely completion of the deliverables.

First-generation Python scripts have been created to compute the modifications that need to be made to the grid model, so that these ‚Äúadditional capacities‚Äù are accounted for. A set of hypotheses is used to determine how these capacities must be accounted for. The script can currently only be used in combination with the grid computation tool DigSilent PowerFactory.

To support the industrialization of the existing scripts, as well as the inclusion of new functionalities & a full migration to Python, we are looking for a senior data scientist with experience in advanced analytics

The main tasks expected are:

Development of an industrialized full-Python tool from requirements & first-generation script.
A refactoring of the scripts to distinguish the parts that must run within DigSilent PowerFactory or not.
Efficient programming to improve readability & performance, while coping with vast amounts of data.
Modular programming to anticipate future functionalities.
The inclusion of completeness verifications for input data.
The development of additional functionalities in close collaboration with the business experts, to limit manual pre-processing of the input data.
The creation of clear & maintainable documentation for the developed tool.







Technical profile requirements

The following competencies are required for this position:

Python programming language experience
Efficient programming, to cope with vast amounts of data
Modular programming, adaptable to changing needs
Profiling and optimization of scripts
Code documentation

Requirements:

At least 5 years‚Äô experience in Python programming
Fluency in English (spoken & written) as well as Dutch and/or French
Basic knowledge of electricity or electric power systems (grid structure, localization of electrical generation and consumption, etc.) is a plus.
Ability to handle vast amounts of data in an efficient manner
Well-organized and attention to details,
Fluent communication and coordination,
Autonomous and capable to manage & respect deadlines,
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills: ability to analyze, interpret and utilize data effectively for their desired purposes.







A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women‚Äôs Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America‚Äôs Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Position Overview




We are seeking a skilled MLOps Engineer / AI Engineer to join our team in Brussels. In this role, you will be instrumental in bridging the gap between Data Science initiatives and IT operations. You will focus on the deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring smooth integration into organizational infrastructure. Additionally, you will be involved in lifecycle management, scalability improvements, and performance optimization of AI systems.




Key Responsibilities




Model Deployment: Work closely with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models into production, adhering to best practices in security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated, efficient data pipelines to enable continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Support project teams by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment workflows.
Data Flow Design: Build and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage solutions, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI-driven applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Utilize Kubernetes to manage the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource usage and system reliability.
Incident Management: Respond promptly to incidents, troubleshoot technical issues, communicate updates to stakeholders, and conduct root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Investigate and implement innovative solutions to improve AI capabilities and streamline model integration.




Requirements




Education

Solid knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.




Technical Expertise

Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have: Experience with SQL, PostgreSQL, MLflow, and Helm charts.




Soft Skills

Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.




Language Proficiency

Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Proficiency in Dutch or French is required.







If this opportunity is interesting for you, please forward your CV to Lkiani@montash.be OR simply apply via LinkedIn.

Show more
HTML:
Position Overview


We are seeking a skilled MLOps Engineer / AI Engineer to join our team in Brussels. In this role, you will be instrumental in bridging the gap between Data Science initiatives and IT operations. You will focus on the deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring smooth integration into organizational infrastructure. Additionally, you will be involved in lifecycle management, scalability improvements, and performance optimization of AI systems.


Key Responsibilities


  • Model Deployment: Work closely with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models into production, adhering to best practices in security, scalability, and reliability.
  • Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated, efficient data pipelines to enable continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
  • Environment Setup: Support project teams by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment workflows.
  • Data Flow Design: Build and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage solutions, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI-driven applications.
  • Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
  • Kubernetes Orchestration: Utilize Kubernetes to manage the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource usage and system reliability.
  • Incident Management: Respond promptly to incidents, troubleshoot technical issues, communicate updates to stakeholders, and conduct root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
  • Innovation and Optimization: Investigate and implement innovative solutions to improve AI capabilities and streamline model integration.


Requirements


Education

  • Solid knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise

  • Strong proficiency in Python.
  • Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
  • Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
  • Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
  • Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
  • Nice to have: Experience with SQL, PostgreSQL, MLflow, and Helm charts.


Soft Skills

  • Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
  • Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
  • Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency

  • Fluent in English (spoken and written).
  • Proficiency in Dutch or French is required.



If this opportunity is interesting for you, please forward your CV to Lkiani@montash.be OR simply apply via LinkedIn.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Legal Entity: ELECTRABEL

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Master's Degree

Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI
Description:
Data Scientist - Gen AI

2 year contract

2 days a week on site




A leading financial services company based in Brussels is seeking a skilled Data Scientist with expertise in Generative AI. You will work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, applying your analytical and technical skills to solve internal business challenges. You will help identify impactful use cases, developing AI-driven solutions, and contributing to the evolution of internal GenAI capabilities and best practices.




Skills Required




5‚Äì8 years of experience in data science
Fluent in French or Dutch
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
Expertise in data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning
Proficiency in Python and libraries such as Pandas & NumPy
Cloud platform experience, particularly with Azure
Deep knowledge of LLM libraries like Langchain, LangGraph
Experience deploying and monitoring GenAI models




Contact Adam Morgan for more information
